The number of confirmed COVID-19 cases in West Sussex so far as at 04 May is 274,303 (31,615 cases per 100,000 population). In the seven days to 29 April, there were 1,187 new confirmed cases (136.8 new cases per 100,000). In the seven days to 22 April, there were 1,887 new cases, and so the new cases have decreased by 37% (700 fewer cases).
